title.value: Перспективные гибриды вишни селекции РУП 'Институт плодоводства'
Promising sour cherry hybrids of the Institute for Fruit Growing breeding

person.name: Taranov, A.A., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Potato, Vegetable and Fruit Growing (Belarus). Institute for Fruit Growing

abstract.value: The results of initial cultivar study of basic economic and biological indicators of 36 own breeding sour cherry (Prunus cerasus L.) hybrids of 2000-2006 planting were presented in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus. To improve sour cherry assortment for breeding in the directions mentioned below and based on the results of sour cherry samples study, 13 sources of winter hardiness (84-6/1, 98-7/15, 98-8/1, 98-8/18, 86-15/50, 86-16/29, 91-27/40, 93-28/99, 93-28/101, 97-31/67, 97-32/95, 97-33/29, 97-97-33/43), 7 ones of high productivity (84-6/1, 98-7/30, 98-8/18, 93-28/99, 93-28/101, 97-32/95, 97-33/29), 3 ones of high complex disease resistance (98-8/18, 93-28/99, 97-32/95), and 6 sources of high fruit quality (84-6/1, 98-7/15, 98-8/18, 86-15/50, 97-32/95, 01-7/1) were singled out. 5 cherry hybrid seedlings (84-6/1, 98-7/15, 98-8/18, 93-28/99, 97-32/95) were revealed by the complex of economically valuable characteristics (high winter hardiness, high yield and fruit quality and disease resistance). The very seedlings are the challengers for elite seedlings and future cultivars.
